unnormalised: Okay, so you're asking about Gastroenterology, right? It's basically all things tummy-related! Think about it – your stomach, intestines, liver, pancreas, gallbladder...all those important bits involved in digestion. A gastroenterologist, or GI doc as some ppl call them, is the specialist who knows everything about these organs and the problems that can affect them.
normalised: Okay, so you are asking about Gastroenterology, right? It is basically all things tummy related! Think about it – your stomach, intestines, liver, pancreas, gallbladder...all those important bits involved in digestion. A gastroenterologist, or G-I doc as some people call them, is the specialist who knows everything about these organs and the problems that can affect them.

unnormalised: Now, why would you need to see a gastroenterologist in India? Well, honestly, there are quite a few reasons. Given our diverse food habits and sometimes questionable hygiene, digestive issues are super common. For example, a lot of people suffer from acidity and GERD – you know, that burning sensation in your chest after eating spicy food. Then there are things like Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), which affects lakhs of people, and Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD), like Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis. These conditions can cause a lot of discomfort and require specialized care. Plus, conditions like jaundice are very common in places like Kolkata.

unnormalised: And it's not just about discomfort; some GI problems can be serious. Liver diseases, including hepatitis (A, B, and C), are a big concern in India. Cirrhosis, which can be caused by alcohol abuse or chronic hepatitis, is also pretty prevalent. And sadly, GI cancers, like stomach cancer or colon cancer, are on the rise. The earlier you get these things checked, the better. Colonoscopies, for instance, are recommended for people over 45 yrs old.

unnormalised: So, if you're experiencing persistent symptoms like abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, constipation, or blood in your stool, it's a good idea to consult a gastroenterologist. They can perform tests like endoscopy (where they use a tiny camera to look inside your digestive tract) or colonoscopy to figure out what's going on. Even simple things like persistent heartburn should be checked. My cousin had heartburn for like 6 months and ended up needing surgery!

unnormalised: Where to find a good one? Major hospitals like AIIMS, Apollo, Fortis, and Max Healthcare usually have excellent gastroenterology departments. Look for doctors with DM (Doctorate of Medicine) in Gastroenterology or equivalent qualifications. Websites like Practo can also help you find GI specialists in your city. You can also check out reviews from other patients, which can be super helpful. Remember to book an appointment well in advance, especially if you're going to a well-known doctor. A good consultation can cost you anywhere between Rs. 800 to Rs. 2500.

unnormalised: Prevention is always better than cure, so try to maintain a healthy diet, get enough exercise, and avoid excessive alcohol consumption. Many stomach problems in India can be traced back to diet and lifestyle. Also, ensure you're getting vaccinated against hepatitis A and B, if you haven't already. Drinking RO water also helps.
